name: Application Log
title: Application Log Pipelines

deletePipeline.alarm: Please open the pipeline and delete all log sources first.

deleteTips: Are you sure you want to delete the application log

detail.tip1: If you create an log source from an instance group, make sure you have attached these
detail.tip3: to the instances. This is NOT required if you create log source from Syslog or EKS cluster.
detail.noLogging: This log pipeline has no buffer layer, logs are sent drectly to OpenSearch domain from source, no log processor lambda was created, hence no logs to dispiay

ingestion.deleteTips: Are you sure you want to delete the log source(s)?
ingestion.eksTips1: If you need to create additional EKS log source(s) in this pipeline, go to
ingestion.eksTips3: create log source and select current pipeline.
ingestion.oneMoreStep: One more step to complete the log source setup...
ingestion.groupTips: We detect you had created an log source with an instance group based on EC2 auto scaling group, please wait for the log source's status become "Created", then go to the detail page of instance group(s), and follow the Auto Scaling Group Guide to update the User Data in the associated Launch Configuration.
ingestion.oneMoreStepEKS: Deploy Fluent Bit in your EKS cluster
ingestion.eksDeamonSetTips_1: In order to activate the log pipeline, please follow the procedures in
ingestion.eksDeamonSetTips_2: to deploy Fluent Bit in your EKS cluster.
ingestion.permissionInfo: For source of Instance Group, please make sure the instances in the Instance Group has correct permission attached. You can view the the required permission in the the source detail page by clicking the source ID.

permission.name: Instance Permission
permission.alertDesc: Solution use Systems Manager to configure and update Log Agent, S3 to store configurations and Kinesis to collect data. Please grant the following permissions to your EC2 Instance Profile or Autoscaling group. Learn more about

create.name: Create

ingestSetting.indexNameDesc: Enter the index name of the log saved in OpenSearch.
ingestSetting.indexNameFormatError: Index name must start with a lowercase letter and can only support lowercase letter, number, - and _
ingestSetting.bufferNoneDesc: Log will ingested to OpenSearch directly. Use this option if your OpenSearch domain can support your log peak throughput.
ingestSetting.bufferKDSDesc: Second-level ingestion with additional cost. Use this option if you need real-time ingestion and your log throughput is higher than your OpenSearch domain ingestion capacity.
ingestSetting.bufferS3Desc: Minute-level ingestion with additional cost. Use this option if you can accept minute-level latency for your log ingestion and your log throughput is higher than your OpenSearch domain ingestion capacity.
ingestSetting.bufferS3LightEngineDesc: The bucket stores log data in its original format to ensure data integrity and traceability.
ingestSetting.bufferNoneNetworkDesc: When no buffer is selected, the log source will send logs to OpenSearch directly, you need to ensure the log sources (i.e., Instance group, EKS cluster, syslog agents) can connect to selected OpenSearch domain.
ingestSetting.bufferNoneConfirm: I acknowledge the requirement of network connectivity.
ingestSetting.bufferNoneNotCheckError: Please confirm and check acknowledge the requirement of network connectivity.
ingestSetting.s3BucketDesc: Select a bucket to store the log data. By default. The solution will add prefix of 'AppLogs/<index-prefix>/year=%Y/month=%m/day=%d/' (in UTC) to log data. You can customize the prefix in additional settings.
ingestSetting.s3PrefixInvalid: Amazon S3 Bucket Prefix should not be '/' and must be end with '/'.
ingestSetting.s3BucketPrefixLightEngineDesc: Select a bucket to store the log data. By default. The solution will add prefix of 'LightEngine/AppLogs/<table-name>' to log data.
ingestSetting.s3BucketPrefixDesc1: By default, Solution appends the prefix '
ingestSetting.s3BucketPrefixDesc2: ' (in UTC) to the data it delivers to Amazon S3. You can override this default by specifying a custom prefix that includes expressions that are evaluated at runtime. If the files to be ingested are all in the log/ folder, you can specify the prefix as log/
ingestSetting.bufferSizeDesc: Specify the buffer size in your log source before sending to Amazon S3. The higher buffer size may be lower in cost with higher latency. The lower buffer size will be faster in delivery with higher cost. Minimum: 1 MiB, maximum: 50 MiB.
ingestSetting.bufferSizeError: The size of the buffer must be between 1MiB and 50MiB
ingestSetting.bufferIntDesc: The higher interval allows more time to collect data and the size of data may be bigger. The lower interval sends the data more frequently and may be more advantageous when looking at shorter cycles of data activity.
ingestSetting.bufferIntError: The Buffer interval must be between 1 second and 86400 seconds
ingestSetting.compressTypeDesc: Solution can compress records before delivering them to your S3 bucket
ingestSetting.shardNumDesc: Specify the number of Shards of the Kinesis Data Streams. Each shard can have up to 1,000 records per second and total data write rate of 1MB per second. (* Kinesis shard adjustment limit per 24 hours)
ingestSetting.shardNumError: Shard Number must be greater than or equal to 1
ingestSetting.enableAutoSDesc: Enable auto scaling of the Kinesis Data Streams shards?
ingestSetting.maxShardNumError: Max Shard Number must be greater than Shard number
ingestSetting.duplicatedWithPrefix: You have a log pipeline that used this index prefix.
ingestSetting.overlapWithPrefix: The index prefix overlaps with the index prefix you created earlier.
ingestSetting.duplicatedWithInvalidPrefix: You have a deleted log pipeline that used this index prefix. If you keep creating this log pipeline, your logs will get mixed up.
ingestSetting.overlapWithInvalidPrefix: The index prefix overlaps with the index prefix you removed earlier. If you continue to create this pipeline, your logs will get mixed up.
ingestSetting.s3StorageClassDesc: Select a storage class for the prefix that buffer your log data.

specifyOS.aosDomainDesc1: Select an imported cluster. You must
specifyOS.aosDomainDesc3: before you select from the list.
specifyOS.warmLogDesc1: Move aged logs from hot storage to warm storage to save cost. You must enable
specifyOS.coldLogDesc1: Move aged logs from warm storage to cold storage to save cost. You must enable
specifyOS.coldLogMustThanWarm: Cold log must larger than warm log transition.
specifyOS.logRetentionDesc: Delete aged logs from OpenSearch domain.
specifyOS.logRetentionMustLargeThanCodeAndWarm: Log retention must larger than cold log transition and warm log transition.
specifyOS.indexSuffixDesc: The default index is <index name>-YYYY-MM-DD. You can choose a different suffix to adjust the index rollover time window. For example, if you select “YYYY-MM-DD-HH” suffix, OpenSearch will rollover the index by hour.

create.domainStatusCheckFailedError: The connectivity check for the selected domain has failed. Please check its network or choose another domain.

ec2.title: Instance Group
ec2.desc: is a concept that represents a collection of one or multiple Amazon EC2 instances. The solution supports automatically collecting logs from the EC2 instances within an Instance Group. With this feature, you can:
ec2.li1: Select Amazon EC2 instance(s) or an Auto Scaling Group to create Instance Group.
ec2.li2: One-click to install log agent (Fluent Bit) on all instances in an Instance Group.
ec2.li3: Use built-in or custom Log Config to parse logs before ingesting into OpenSearch.

arch.title: Architecture Diagram
arch.desc: The architecture diagram to ingest log data into Amazon OpenSearch domain.
arch.descLightEngine: The architecture diagram to ingest log data into Light Engine.

step1.permissionsDesc: The instance groups needs permissions to access System Manager, S3, and Kinesis Data Stream services for log collection agent configuration and log transmission. Please select a method to add permissions to the instances. Learn more about
step1.permissionAuto: Solution automatically adds the required permission to the selected instances’ Instance Profile
step1.permissionManual: I will manually add the below required permissions after pipeline creation
step1.userDataExpand: Expand to view the user data scripts
step1.title: Choose instance groups
step1.titleDesc: Instance group is a collection of multiple instances that will be applied with same Log Config.

step2.logPathDesc: Enter the location of the log files. All files under the specified folder will be included.

step3.title: Buffer layer
step3.desc: Select a layer to buffer your logs before ingestion

eks.title: Amazon EKS
eks.desc: Amazon EKS is a fully-managed and certified Kubernetes service. The solution supports automatically collecting logs from application runs on Amazon EKS. With this feature, you can:
eks.li1: Automatically generate ready-to-use YAML file to easily install of log agent (Fluent Bit) on EKS.
eks.li2: Use built-in or custom Log Config to parse logs before ingesting into OpenSearch.
eks.li3: Ingest logs from EKS in different AWS accounts.

arch.title: Architecture Diagram
arch.desc: The architecture diagram to ingest log data into Amazon OpenSearch domain.
arch.descLightEngine: The architecture diagram to ingest log data into Light Engine.

step1.title: Choose EKS cluster
step1.titleDesc: Select an EKS cluster to collect logs from.
step1.accountDesc: Select the AWS account at which the log is stored. To create a member account, go to

step2.title: Apply log config
step2.titleDesc: Create a new Log Config or select exists.
step2.logConfigDesc: Choose a log config to parse your logs.

step3_1.title: Select log processor
step3_1.lambdaDesc: Serverless processor that automatically scale out or in, cost efficient processor when daily log volume is less then 1 TB.
step3_1.osisDesc: Managed ingestion service that is cost efficient when log volume > 1TB/day, also provides rich log processing capabilities.

step3.title: Buffer layer
step3.desc: Select a layer to buffer your logs before ingestion

eks.deleteAlarm1: Please open the pipeline and delete all log sources first.
eks.roleCheckFailed: The role used to send logs to Buffering layer takes too long to be active. Please try again.

syslog.title: Syslog Endpoint
syslog.desc: Syslog is a standard network-based logging protocol that works on a wide variety of different types of devices and applications, such as Linux servers, firewalls, and network devices. This solution supports collecting logs from system agents (e.g., rsyslog, syslog-ng) directly. With this feature, you can:
syslog.li1: Automatically deploy a highly-available network endpoint to collect syslog sent over network.
syslog.li2: Use built-in Log Configs to parse standard syslog formats. (e.g., RFC3164, RFC5424)
syslog.li3: Ingest syslog via UDP and TCP protocols.

arch.title: Architecture Diagram
arch.desc: The architecture diagram to ingest log data into Amazon OpenSearch domain.

step1.title: Ingestion endpoint
step1.titleDesc: Specify the settings for the endpoint to receive syslog.
step1.desc: Select the S3 bucket where your logs are stored.
step1.alert: Currently only support ingesting logs from solution-deployed region.
step1.desc2: Filter files by file path prefix to accurately locate the files to be ingested. We support both full file path matching and Wildcard matching. For example, if the files to be ingested are all in the log/ folder, you can specify the prefix as log/. If you want to only ingest file with log as file name, you can specify the prefix as log/*.log. If this parameter is not set, the entire S3 bucket will be traversed.
step1.desc3: Specify the interval for the ingestion job to execute.
step1.onGoingDesc: The ingestion job will run when a new file is delivered to the specified S3 location
step1.oneTimeLoadDesc: The ingestion job will run at creation and only will run once to load all files in the specified location.

step2.title: Apply log config
step2.titleDesc: Create a new Log Config or select exists.
step2.logConfigDesc: Choose a log config to parse your logs. Only can choose syslog-supported log config (i.e., Single-line Text, Syslog, JSON).

step3_1.title: Select log processor
step3_1.lambdaDesc: Serverless processor that automatically scale out or in, cost efficient processor when daily log volume is less then 1 TB.
step3_1.osisDesc: Managed ingestion service that is cost efficient when log volume > 1TB/day, also provides rich log processing capabilities.

step3.title: Buffer layer
step3.desc: Select a layer to buffer your logs before ingestion

s3.title: Amazon S3
s3.desc: This solution supports ingesting logs that stored in a Amazon S3 bucket. You can use this feature to ingest logs of AWS services that support delivering logs to S3, ingest logs from on-premises, or ingest logs from third-party cloud providers that could be transferred to a S3 bucket. With this features, you can:
s3.li1: Ingest logs in a specified S3 location continuously or perform one-time ingestion.
s3.li2: Filter logs based on S3 prefix.
s3.li3: Parse logs with custom Log Config.

arch.title: Architecture Diagram
arch.desc: The architecture diagram to ingest log data into Amazon OpenSearch domain.

step1.title: Specify source settings
step1.alertCompressionType: Note you can not change compression type when adding a new source into an existing pipeline, please make sure the new log source is in the same compression format.
step1.titleDesc: Specify the settings for the log sources.
step1.desc: Select the S3 bucket where your logs are stored. Note that only the S3 buckets in the same region can be selected.
step1.alert: Currently only support ingesting logs from solution-deployed region.
step1.desc2: Filter log files by prefix to accurately locate the files to be ingested. The solution supports both full file path matching and Wildcard matching. If this parameter is not set, the entire S3 bucket will be traversed.
step1.desc3: Specify the interval for the ingestion job to execute.
step1.desc4: Specify how the log files are compressed in S3
step1.onGoingDesc: The ingestion job will run when a new file is delivered to the specified S3 location
step1.oneTimeLoadDesc: The ingestion job will run at creation and only will run once to load all files in the specified location.

step2.title: Apply log config
step2.titleDesc: Create a new Log Config or select exists.
step2.logConfigDesc: Choose a log config to parse your logs.
step2.alert: If you select a log config with filter enabled, filter in the log config will not take effect.
step2.alertCanNotChangeLogConfig: Note you can not change log config when add a new source into an existing pipeline, please review and ensure the existing log config can parse the new log source.

step3.title: Select log processor
step3.lambdaDesc: Serverless processor that automatically scale out or in, cost efficient processor when daily log volume is less then 1 TB.
step3.osisDesc: Managed ingestion service that is cost efficient when log volume > 1TB/day, also provides rich log processing capabilities.

instancePermission.alertContent: Please make sure your instance have the following permissions.
